title: Facing toughest election in years, Turkey’s Erdogan lashes out
description: Erdogan's rancorous rhetoric reflects the pressures and peril of an election unlike any other during his two decades as Turkey's dominant political figure.

title: How Ukrainian forces denied Russia victory in Bakhmut by Victory Day
description: A surprise offensive outside the city and dogged resistance in the center kept Putin from being able to trumpet the conquest of Bakhmut on Russia's May 9 holiday.

title: Fighting still rages in Sudan despite talk of truce progress
description: Following a U.S. announcement that the two sides were ready to negotiate a truce and would respect civilian needs, little has changed in fighting across the country.

title: Israel and Gaza militants face off for fourth day amid scramble for truce
description: At least 31 people have been killed in Gaza, a Palestinian enclave blockaded by Israel and Egypt, since Israeli airstrikes began Tuesday against the Islamic Jihad.

title: Pakistani court grants Imran Khan bail, legal team says
description: Bail could calm the protesters in Pakistan, but the opposition leader and former prime minister could still be rearrested on other charges.

title: China, ever so tentatively, signals willingness to talk to U.S. again
description: Relations between Washington and Beijing hit new lows with the balloon incident, but there are signs that Chinese officials might be interested in talking again.

title: Biden faces major challenges with the end of the Title 42 border policy
description: The Title 42 border policy used during the pandemic to quickly expel migrants who were in the U.S. illegally was set to expire Friday.

title: Myanmar military raids left trail of decapitated bodies, report finds
description: The junta has been beheading and dismembering suspected resistance members, according to Myanmar Witness, which investigates possible rights violations.

title: Is it discrimination if you can’t bring your kids to a restaurant?
description: After a cafe turned away her family, a South Korean lawmaker vowed to ban "no-kid zones," which have generated heated debate around the world.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Zelensky says counteroffensive hasn’t started. Wagner’s chief disagrees.
description: The U.S. ambassador to South Africa accused his host country of shipping weapons to Russia in violation of its self-proclaimed policy of nonalignment.

title: Serbians hand in thousands of guns after two mass killings
description: Citizens surrendered nearly 6,000 weapons and 300,000 rounds of ammunition in the first three days of an amnesty. Serbia also committed to new gun-control policies.

title: Elections could oust Thai military after a decade in power: What to know
description: Ruling military led by Prayuth faces challenge from Paetongtarn's Pheu Thai party and Pita's Move Forward party.

title: Will Turkey’s elections be free and fair? Here’s what to know.
description: Even as their country sinks deeper into authoritarianism, Turks love to vote — and have a real chance of reshaping their country’s politics.
